rComments: Very messy, unorganized, unclear, and hard person. He is rude sometimes and he knows his thing but does not know how to teach at all. 1 WORST professor ever. Doesn't teach anything and expects you to know everything on the test which is far from what he goes over in class.

Joe is a great lecturer, very enthusiastic on the subject (although he tends to ramble...) It's a challenging course, you need to keep up with the lectures/hw/readings from start to finish!  I tried really hard, and am broken hearted over my B ... :(

Very Good Professor! O.Chem is not an easy course, but Joe really makes it worthwhile. Joe is a very fair grader and is good at explaining the material. Definitely go to office hours. Stay at least 1/2 chapter ahead of lecture. Be ready to be called upon for the answer to a problem he might be doing on the board. Practice exams are similar to tests

Best chemistry prof I've ever had!  He's incredibly enthusiastic about the class, and passionate about his students.  Good lecturer, goes a bit fast though.  Ochem is a hard class no matter who teaches it, so study every day and know your reactions... tests are a bit hard, but fair... study and you'll do well.

get the book--itll be your world. memorize the functional groups and mechanisms, then youll be set. attending lectures wasnt really needed but a good intro to what you would expect to be reading. stay ahead and read everything- soln manual has all the HW problems so check your work. if you find this course SUPER hard then change your major.

Joe is a HARD tester, but he grades very fairly. Just do the homework, listen to the lectures and you'll be alright. For all of you out there that think this class was too hard with Joe, you may want to think about changing majors.

Joe was very fair and fun to listen to in class.  He never is short of energy and is willing to help if you go to him. His homework load honestly wasn't as hard as some of the GenChem loads and quite honestly was very easy to complete. Grading was very fair with 50% in the quarter = C-. Midterms were very doable and prep was key.  Just STUDY!

Best Chem teacher ever!  Study like crazy, and you will do fine.  He really does care, and is a nice guy. If you study his old tests, and really understand them you will do fine.  If you Study them and just try and memorize you will fail.  Its a hard class, but he does an exceptional job teaching.

He did a good job presenting the material, although he does go fast but that's how the course is and it helps you stay on top of your studies.  He was very enthustiastic, which kept me from falling asleep.  His exams are challenging but if you study passing is very duable and they are fair.

Organic Chemistry is a difficult subject to learn, and to teach. That being the case, Joe Konopelski does just about the best job possible at teaching such a difficult subject. He likes to single you out in a class of 350 and ask you really difficult questions that no one knows the answer to. Stay away from front row. Tests were fair, mostly.

dude seriously wtf! i studied the shiet outta this class and it was HARD as ****. there arent any good ochem professors at ucsc except daniel pall. < dunno how you spell his name.  but yeah... you are pretty much fcked if you take ochem the first time from him
He is a cool prof. Hard, but fare. takes no brainer to pass the class, rest is up to student!

enthusiastic about the material. this class was hard. the tests were fair but still hard. make sure you read the text, understand the concepts and memorize the reactions! HW is a must do it even if you have to copy its worth the same as the final. form a study group.class test average was about 55%

This class was not too bad. The tests were challenging but fair. The homework consists of a large percentage of the class, so do the homework. Overall, he was a very fair professor. If you get 50% of the total points, you pass. Just keep up with the material, and you should do fine.
No Comments

Joe is an awesome teacher. He was a great lecturer and of course the class was hard, its ochem, which involves alot of memorization. He genuinely wants all of his students to do well, but he also gives fair credit to the students who excell (only need 50 to pass, but an A is a big deal).

This guy is cool.  super funny and very excited about everything.  the class isn't as hard as i thought it would be.  if you go to lectures and read you should be fine.  and do the homework because that's what you need for tests.

His lectures were ok, and his tests are hard, but luckily he uses a modified curve system to grade. Also, homework counted as much as the final, so even if you just copy straight out of the solutions manual, turn it in!

This class wasnt too bad, if your a chemistry type of girl its easy, but if your not prepare to study your brains out, he wasnt the best lecturer but his enthusiasm made the time go by pretty fast. Not a class to get behind in.
Ochem is lots of work, and he is not a good lecturer. Ridiculously hard tests, not helpful in office hours, takes work just to get a C.  Do MSI or ACE, because the course is tough.

Hard, hard, hard.  Thank god for the fat curve.  Beware of sitting in the front of the class.  He points at people and asks them really hard questions that no one knows the answer to.  He is a really nice guy though and office hours are super helpful.

the class was a b*tch. difficult material. the help he offers isnt helpful at all becase he just doesn't get it that some of us hate chemistry and cant get it through our thick skulls. overall, very nice guy and is trly interested in his students' progres
